trans-unit.source: Develop video player applications
trans-unit.target: Develop video player applications

trans-unit.source: The topic provides links to Player Frameworks and plugins that you can use to develop your own client applications that can consume streaming media from Media Services.
trans-unit.target: The topic provides links to Player Frameworks and plugins that you can use to develop your own client applications that can consume streaming media from Media Services.

trans-unit.source: Develop video player applications
trans-unit.target: Develop video player applications

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Services provides the tools you need to create rich, dynamic client player applications for most platforms including: iOS Devices, Android Devices, Windows, Windows Phone, Xbox, and Set-top boxes.
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Services provides the tools you need to create rich, dynamic client player applications for most platforms including: iOS Devices, Android Devices, Windows, Windows Phone, Xbox, and Set-top boxes.

trans-unit.source: This topic also provides links to SDKs and Player Frameworks that you can use to develop your own client applications that can consume streaming media from Azure Media Services.
trans-unit.target: This topic also provides links to SDKs and Player Frameworks that you can use to develop your own client applications that can consume streaming media from Azure Media Services.

trans-unit.source: Playback your content with existing players
trans-unit.target: Playback your content with existing players

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [playing your content with existing players](media-services-playback-content-with-existing-players.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [playing your content with existing players](media-services-playback-content-with-existing-players.md).

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Player
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Player

trans-unit.source: [Azure Media Player](http://aka.ms/ampinfo) is a web video player built to play back media content from Microsoft Azure Media Services on a wide variety of browsers and devices.
trans-unit.target: [Azure Media Player](http://aka.ms/ampinfo) is a web video player built to play back media content from Microsoft Azure Media Services on a wide variety of browsers and devices.

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Player utilizes industry standards, such as HTML5, Media Source Extensions (MSE), and Encrypted Media Extensions (EME) to provide an enriched adaptive streaming experience.
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Player utilizes industry standards, such as HTML5, Media Source Extensions (MSE), and Encrypted Media Extensions (EME) to provide an enriched adaptive streaming experience.

trans-unit.source: When these standards are not available on a device or in a browser, Azure Media Player uses Flash and Silverlight as fallback technology.
trans-unit.target: When these standards are not available on a device or in a browser, Azure Media Player uses Flash and Silverlight as fallback technology.

trans-unit.source: Regardless of the playback technology used, developers will have a unified JavaScript interface to access APIs.
trans-unit.target: Regardless of the playback technology used, developers will have a unified JavaScript interface to access APIs.

trans-unit.source: This allows for content served by Azure Media Services to be played across a wide-range of devices and browsers without any extra effort.
trans-unit.target: This allows for content served by Azure Media Services to be played across a wide-range of devices and browsers without any extra effort.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Media Services allows for content to be served up with DASH, Smooth Streaming, and HLS streaming formats to play back content.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Media Services allows for content to be served up with DASH, Smooth Streaming, and HLS streaming formats to play back content.

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Player takes into account these various formats and automatically plays the best link based on the platform/browser capabilities.
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Player takes into account these various formats and automatically plays the best link based on the platform/browser capabilities.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Media Services also allows for dynamic encryption of assets with PlayReady encryption or AES-128 bit envelope encryption.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Media Services also allows for dynamic encryption of assets with PlayReady encryption or AES-128 bit envelope encryption.

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Player allows for decryption of PlayReady and AES-128 bit encrypted content when appropriately configured.
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Player allows for decryption of PlayReady and AES-128 bit encrypted content when appropriately configured.

trans-unit.target: For more information:

trans-unit.source: XBOX Video Application Development
trans-unit.target: XBOX Video Application Development

trans-unit.source: Advertising
trans-unit.target: Advertising

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Services provides support for ad insertion through the Windows Media Platform: Player Frameworks.
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Services provides support for ad insertion through the Windows Media Platform: Player Frameworks.

trans-unit.source: Player frameworks with ad support are available for Windows 8, Silverlight, Windows Phone 8, and iOS devices.
trans-unit.target: Player frameworks with ad support are available for Windows 8, Silverlight, Windows Phone 8, and iOS devices.

trans-unit.source: Each player framework contains sample code that shows you how to implement a player application.
trans-unit.target: Each player framework contains sample code that shows you how to implement a player application.

trans-unit.source: There are three different kinds of ads you can insert into your media:
trans-unit.target: There are three different kinds of ads you can insert into your media:

trans-unit.source: Linear – full frame ads that pause the main video
trans-unit.target: Linear – full frame ads that pause the main video

trans-unit.source: Nonlinear – overlay ads that are displayed as the main video is playing, usually a logo or other static image placed within the player
trans-unit.target: Nonlinear – overlay ads that are displayed as the main video is playing, usually a logo or other static image placed within the player

trans-unit.source: Companion – ads that are displayed outside of the player
trans-unit.target: Companion – ads that are displayed outside of the player

trans-unit.source: Ads can be placed at any point in the main video’s time line.
trans-unit.target: Ads can be placed at any point in the main video’s time line.

trans-unit.source: You must tell the player when to play the ad and which ads to play.
trans-unit.target: You must tell the player when to play the ad and which ads to play.

trans-unit.source: This is done using a set of standard XML-based files: Video Ad Service Template (VAST), Digital Video Multiple Ad Playlist (VMAP), Media Abstract Sequencing Template (MAST), and Digital Video Player Ad Interface Definition (VPAID).
trans-unit.target: This is done using a set of standard XML-based files: Video Ad Service Template (VAST), Digital Video Multiple Ad Playlist (VMAP), Media Abstract Sequencing Template (MAST), and Digital Video Player Ad Interface Definition (VPAID).

trans-unit.source: VAST files specify what ads to display.
trans-unit.target: VAST files specify what ads to display.

trans-unit.source: VMAP files specify when to play various ads and contain VAST XML.
trans-unit.target: VMAP files specify when to play various ads and contain VAST XML.

trans-unit.source: MAST files are another way to sequence ads which also can contain VAST XML.
trans-unit.target: MAST files are another way to sequence ads which also can contain VAST XML.

trans-unit.source: VPAID files define an interface between the video player and the ad or ad server.
trans-unit.target: VPAID files define an interface between the video player and the ad or ad server.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Inserting Ads](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn387398.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Inserting Ads](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn387398.aspx).

trans-unit.source: For information about closed captioning and ads support in Live streaming videos, see [Supported Closed Captioning and Ad Insertion Standards](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/c49e0b4d-357e-4cca-95e5-2288924d1ff3#caption_ad).
trans-unit.target: For information about closed captioning and ads support in Live streaming videos, see [Supported Closed Captioning and Ad Insertion Standards](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/c49e0b4d-357e-4cca-95e5-2288924d1ff3#caption_ad).
